docs.snippet: Major League Baseball and the players association agree to the most significant toughening of its antidrug rules in eight years....
docs.lead_paragraph: Major League Baseball and the players association agree to the most significant toughening of its antidrug rules in eight years.
docs.abstract: Major League Baseball and the players association agree to the most significant toughening of antidrug rules in eight years; length of suspensions for performance-enhancing drug violations will increase and players suspended during the season will not be eligible for that year's postseason.

headline.main: Suspended M.L.B. Players Now Ineligible for Playoffs

docs.snippet: A collection of autographs from baseball greats....

docs.snippet: Dave Dombrowski, the Detroit Tigers’ general manager, had the opportunity to explain why he signed Miguel Cabrera to a record-setting deal....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dave Dombrowski, the Detroit Tigers’ general manager, had the opportunity to explain why he signed Miguel Cabrera to a record-setting deal.
docs.abstract: Detroit Tigers general manager Dave Dombrowski concedes that 10-year, $292 million contract for first baseman Miguel Cabrera amounts to a gamble; defends choice, saying 30-year-old player is still the best in the game.

headline.main: Detroit Executive Says That, Yes, Cabrera’s Contract Is a Gamble
headline.print_headline: Detroit Executive Says That, Yes, Cabrera’s Contract Is a Gamble

docs.snippet: A group called the Montreal Baseball Project, led by the former Expo Warren Cromartie, has been working to bring a team back to Montreal....
docs.lead_paragraph: A group called the Montreal Baseball Project, led by the former Expo Warren Cromartie, has been working to bring a team back to Montreal.
docs.abstract: Montreal Baseball Project, group led by former player Warren Cromartie, is working to bring the Expos back to Montreal; overwhelming turnout for two preseason games between the New York Mets and the Toronto Blue Jays at Olympic Stadium presents encouraging test case for whether city can support a professional team.

headline.main: Hoping to Hear ‘Play Ball’ in Montreal
headline.print_headline: Hoping to Hear ‘Play Ball’ in Montreal

docs.snippet: Penmanship seems to be a thing of the past in Major League Baseball, with players often leaving autograph collectors scratching their heads....
docs.lead_paragraph: Penmanship seems to be a thing of the past in Major League Baseball, with players often leaving autograph collectors scratching their heads.
docs.abstract: Declining penmanship among Major League baseball players has made it more difficult to distinguish autographs on memorabilia; strong signatures were once considered an indelible mark of identity, but art seems lost in current climate; players say there is not enough time to learn skill and sign objects carefully.

headline.main: In an Era of Squiggles, You Can’t Tell the Players Without a Handwriting Analyst
headline.print_headline: In an Era of Squiggles, You Can’t Tell the Players Without a Handwriting Analyst

docs.snippet: Melky Cabrera's two-run homer in the eighth inning gave the Toronto Blue Jays a 2-0 victory over the New York Mets on Saturday and a sweep of their two-game exhibition series at an Olympic Stadium packed with former Montreal Expos fans....
docs.lead_paragraph: Melky Cabrera's two-run homer in the eighth inning gave the Toronto Blue Jays a 2-0 victory over the New York Mets on Saturday and a sweep of their two-game exhibition series at an Olympic Stadium packed with former Montreal Expos fans.

headline.main: Cabrera's HR Lifts Jays Over Mets 2-0 in Montreal
headline.print_headline: Cabrera's HR Lifts Jays Over Mets 2-0 in Montreal

headline.seo: Elaine St. George Sings Songs by Steve Goodman

docs.snippet: As he watches over dozens of children training on the field where his nephew learned the game, Miguel Cabrera's uncle is proud of the news that the Detroit Tigers slugger has netted the richest contract in history of any U.S. sport....

docs.snippet: The Jockey Club, one of horse racing’s most influential groups, said efforts at reform from within have moved too slowly and “enough was enough.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Jockey Club, one of horse racing’s most influential groups, said efforts at reform from within have moved too slowly and “enough was enough.”
docs.abstract: Jockey Club, one of horse racing’s most influential groups, says it will support federal legislation to put the United States Anti-Doping Agency in charge of eradicating pervasive drug culture in horse racing; group concedes that efforts to reform the sport from within have moved too slowly.

headline.main: Jockey Club Wants U.S. Anti-Doping Agency in Charge
headline.print_headline: Jockey Club Wants U.S. Anti-Doping Agency in Charge
